page.title: 14THE MOAT HOUSE & OLD RECTORY
page.content: Two other houses of historic interest are{The Moat House}and{The Old Rectory The Moat House is all that is left of the original{Manor House}built in the 14th century near the church.The stone part was the gate house which led into a courtyard around which the house was built. The whole was surrounded by a {moat}with a draw-bridge entrance.There is evidence of battlements above the front door. The{timber framed wattle {and daub}section was added in 1560. The{Old Rectory}was built in The 1800s and stands on the western outskirts of the village.The{Moore family not only owned the Hall but at one time provided a rector as well.The present eldest member of the Moore Family,{Aubrey,}is well into his 90's but can remember living at the rectory and attending Appleby Grammar School (The Sir John Moore School) in 1902!
